page.title: 07Self Help Around Braydon
page.content: The communities are spread over a wide area and sparsely populated. To an onlooker they may appear isolated. There is, however, a community spirit in these area and neighbours help each other perhaps to a greater extent than in an inner city area. There is no public transport but this problem is overcome through community self-help. This is in the form of car sharing, doing shopping for neighbours and generally caring for each other. People can travel into Purton to participate in one or more of the many clubs and interest groups. There are clubs for sports, youths, gardening and history as well as WI, National Housewives Register and the Silver Threads Club. The community spirit is in evidence as one car driver brings other neighbours to the clubs.
